Good question. Heres what it says If the Russian economy collapses, it could strain Russias ability to continue the war in Ukraine, potentially hastening an end to the conflict. The subsequent rebuilding of Ukraine would offer significant opportunities for American businesses across various sectors. Companies Likely to Benefit Construction and Engineering Firms Companies like Caterpillar Inc. CAT and Deere Company DE could see increased demand for construction machinery and equipment. Fluor Corporation FLR and Jacobs Solutions Inc. J might secure contracts for largescale engineering and infrastructure projects. Infrastructure and Materials Suppliers Nucor Corporation NUE and Vulcan Materials Company VMC could benefit from supplying steel and aggregates needed for rebuilding roads, bridges, and buildings. Energy Companies Firms specializing in energy infrastructure and renewables, such as NextEra Energy, Inc. NEE and General Electric Company GE, might participate in overhauling Ukraines energy systems. Technology Providers Cisco Systems, Inc. CSCO and Microsoft Corporation MSFT could be involved in restoring and upgrading Ukraines telecommunications and digital infrastructure. Commodities Likely to Benefit Steel and Copper The reconstruction efforts would increase demand for steel and copper, benefiting companies involved in mining and production of these metals. Cement and Lumber Suppliers of cement and lumber would likely see heightened demand as rebuilding efforts commence. These companies and commodities stand to gain from contracts and increased demand associated with rebuilding Ukraines infrastructure, energy grids, and urban developments, presenting potential growth opportunities for investors.

Unfortunately or fortunately, depending on your PoV, Ukraines military resistance is likely to exhaust and collapse much faster than Russias economy. Russians are not soft pussies like us in the west, the government and the central bank do not mess around, they do not see the choice between 25 and 50 basis points as such a ridiculous drama cutting or raising rates by hundreds of basis points at a time. Most importantly, the citizens are tough and resilient, they are not going to strike or revolt because their living standard went down by 20. US, UK, France or Germany, on the other hand... !imgemotet5_2th524271

Severed all ties to Russia? You cant be serious. !imgemotet5_2th524271 The supply chains have adapted. Wherever necessary, they started routing their crucial commodities from Russia via third countries andor smugglers at a premium. Commodity markets do not behave as some clueless delusional politicians or their even more clueless citizens wish them to. They will only make it seem so via made up commentary in mainstream media. As of September 2024, the West continues to impose heavy sanctions and restrictions on imports of many Russian goods, particularly in the wake of the ongoing conflict in Ukraine. However, some Western countries still import specific Russian products, though in significantly reduced volumes compared to pre2022 levels. Key imports that continue to flow from Russia to Europe and the U.S. include 1. Energy Products Although many European countries have drastically cut their dependence on Russian natural gas and oil, certain imports like liquefied natural gas LNG still persist, albeit at reduced levels. 2. Metals Russian aluminum and derivative products are still imported, though the U.S. imposes a 200 tariff on aluminum and derivative products smelted or cast in Russia, and similar measures are applied to steel and other metals. 3. NonEnergy Commodities Certain agricultural products like fertilizers continue to be imported into Europe due to their critical role in food production. Overall, the proportion of Russian goods imported by the West has significantly decreased due to sanctions, tariffs, and a broader pivot away from reliance on Russian supply chains. The most prominent exceptions are energy and select raw materials, often subject to very high tariffs or specific exclusions. Admiteddly, severed all ties is a bit excessive, severed most of them is more accurate.

Redeye estimates an 85% probability of the Neonode side settling against Samsung in mid-2025, which would give an estimated USD31 per share to Neonode. Further down the road comes Apple, which is more likely to go all the way to trial. A settlement against Samsung would, however, add pressure on Apple (and Google). Redeye estimates that winning in court against Apple can give as much as USD121 per share to Neonode. Redeye thinks chances against Apple are slimmer than against Samsung, and estimates a 20% chance of the Neonode side winning in court against Apple. After that, there is more to chase from not only Google, but likely all smartphone OEMs. Redeye raises its fair value range.
